big_picture_notes: Acts continues Luke’s narrative, structured by the programmatic 1:8 commission: witnesses in Jerusalem, Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth. Literary glue includes travel itineraries, summary growth statements (2:47; 6:7; 9:31; 12:24; 16:5; 19:20; 28:31), abundant speeches (about a third of the book), repeated conversion/testimony accounts, and Spirit-driven guidance. Focus shifts from Peter (1–12) to Paul (13–28). Thematically, it showcases fulfillment of Scripture and Jesus’ promises, with the Holy Spirit as the primary agent advancing the word despite opposition.

stories.story_title: The Witness in Jerusalem (The Church's Foundation)
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) links to Luke and frames the post‑resurrection mission; end (6:7) is a hinge summary concluding the Jerusalem‑centric phase. Glue: unity ‘with one accord,’ apostolic signs, temple focus, community summaries, and increasing conflict with the Sanhedrin.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Bridges Luke→Acts; promise of the Spirit; ascension witnessed and interpreted by angels. Devices: authorial address, theophany, oracle/promise.
Return to Jerusalem; unified prayer names the core circle. Devices: setting shift, compact list, unanimity refrain.
Peter cites Scripture, community prays, and lots appoint Matthias. Devices: scriptural proof, prayer, casting lots closure.
Sound, fire, and tongues draw a multinational crowd and confusion. Devices: sensory theophany, nation list, mockery pivot.
Refutes drunkenness; explains event via Joel’s prophecy. Devices: rebuttal→assertion→proof structure.
Death–resurrection–exaltation argued from Psalms; climax: Jesus is Lord and Christ. Devices: scriptural chain, climactic verdict.
Audience pierced; call to repent/baptize; about three thousand added. Devices: dialogue, summary result.
Devotion to teaching, fellowship, breaking bread, prayers; daily growth. Devices: enumerated practices, favor/growth summary.
At the temple gate, healing in Jesus’ name draws a crowd. Devices: miracle sign, praise, crowd recognition.
Peter redirects glory, indicts ignorance, offers restoration from the prophets. Devices: rhetorical questions, prophetic appeal.
Authorities arrest, yet many believe; number reaches five thousand. Devices: conflict–growth juxtaposition, brief report.
Bold witness; exclusive salvation in Jesus; threats then release. Devices: judicial scene, parrhesia, verdict closure.
Corporate prayer cites Psalm 2; place shakes; Spirit fills anew. Devices: lament‑petition, theophany confirmation.
From ideal generosity (Barnabas) to judged deceit; great fear falls. Devices: contrast pericope, swift judgment.
Many signs; imprisonment; angel frees apostles to resume teaching. Devices: summary→action, angelic intervention.
Empty prison irony; bold reply; Gamaliel’s counsel averts execution; beaten then rejoice. Devices: irony, deliberative speech.
Hellenist complaint resolved by Spirit‑wise deacons; word increases. Devices: problem–solution, hinge summary.

stories.story_title: The Witness in Judea and Samaria (Expansion)
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (6:8) shifts to Stephen, whose martyrdom catalyzes dispersion; end (12:24) is a growth summary closing the persecution arc before the Gentile mission launch. Glue: persecution‑as‑catalyst, Spirit direction, and apostolic validation of Samaritans and Gentiles.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Irresistible wisdom opposed; false charges; Stephen’s radiant face signals divine favor. Devices: conflict build, glory visage.
Historical survey turns accusatory: ‘you always resist the Holy Spirit.’ Devices: extended scriptural retelling, prophetic denunciation.
Vision of the Son of Man; stoning; Saul’s approval; church scattered preaching. Devices: glory–violence juxtaposition, summary pivot.
Joyful reception; apostles confirm with Spirit; Simon’s simony rebuked. Devices: sign‑attested mission, apostolic validation.
Angel and Spirit direct a Scripture‑centered conversion and baptism; Philip transported. Devices: oracle guidance, Isa 53 exegesis.
Heavenly encounter reverses persecutor to witness; sight restored and baptized. Devices: voice‑from‑heaven, sign (‘scales’) closure.
Bold proclamation, plots, and escapes; churches have peace and grow. Devices: danger beats, hinge summary (9:31).
Healings of Aeneas and Tabitha establish Peter’s authority along the coast. Devices: miracle signs, lodging setup in Joppa.
God‑fearing Gentile directed to summon Peter. Devices: angelic visitation, piety characterization as foil.
Threefold vision interpreted by Spirit; Peter descends to go. Devices: thrice repetition, inner dialogue, command obedience.
Peter’s sermon; Spirit falls before baptism; Gentiles baptized. Devices: reversal ordering, equalizing Spirit sign.
Peter recounts events; brethren glorify God for Gentile repentance. Devices: narrated testimony, consensus resolution.
Scattered preaching reaches Antioch; disciples first called Christians; relief sent to Jerusalem. Devices: naming marker, emissary report.
James martyred; Peter imprisoned and freed; Herod judged; word grows. Devices: prayer–deliverance irony (Rhoda), summary hinge.

stories.story_title: To the Ends of the Earth: First Missionary Journey
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (13:1) with Spirit‑directed commissioning at Antioch; end (14:28) with return and report. Glue: itinerary from Cyprus to Pisidia/Lycaonia and back; conflict then turning to Gentiles; elders appointed; inclusio with sending church.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Prophets/teachers at Antioch; Spirit says ‘Set apart’; hands laid and sent. Devices: oracle formula, ritual sending.
Elymas opposed; Paul (name shift) blinds him; proconsul believes. Devices: conflict miracle, leadership shift marker.
Historical survey to resurrection, justified by Scripture; invited back next Sabbath. Devices: synagogue address, fulfillment chain.
City gathers; Jews oppose; Isa 49:6 cited; dust‑shaking; joy. Devices: prophetic warrant, symbolic act.
Bold preaching splits city; plot to stone; they flee. Devices: division motif, protective move.
Healing sparks deification; apostles protest; Jews incite stoning; Paul rises. Devices: irony reversal, resilience sign.
Derbe preached; elders appointed; report God’s open door; long stay in Antioch. Devices: appointment formula, inclusio report.

stories.story_title: The Jerusalem Council (Gospel for Gentiles Confirmed)
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (15:1) with circumcision controversy; end (15:35) with unified ministry post‑decree in Antioch. Glue: multi‑voice testimony (Peter, Barnabas/Paul, James), Scripture (Amos 9), Spirit‑sanctioned consensus (‘seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us’).

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Judaizers trigger debate; delegation welcomed; Pharisee believers restate demand. Devices: controversy setup, venue shift.
God chose Gentiles; hearts purified by faith; law’s yoke rejected. Devices: past narrative appeal, grace principle.
Miracle reports heard; James cites Amos 9; four prohibitions set. Devices: legal decision, scriptural warrant.
Chosen men carry the letter; encouragement and unity result. Devices: epistolary decree, messenger validation, summary close.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (15:36) revisiting churches, then Spirit‑redirects to Europe (Macedonian call); end (18:22) with return to Antioch. Glue: we‑sections begin (16:10), legal precedent (Gallio), and founding of key churches (Philippi, Thessalonica, Corinth).

scenes.scene_name: Split with Barnabas; Silas and Timothy
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Disagreement over Mark; circumcision of Timothy for mission; churches strengthened. Devices: pragmatic concession, summary growth (16:5).
Spirit forbids Asia/Bithynia; vision summons to Macedonia; ‘we’ begin. Devices: negative guidance→positive vision, narrator shift.
Sabbath riverside prayer; the Lord opens Lydia’s heart; hospitality. Devices: divine enablement, house‑church seed.
Spirit expelled; owners retaliate; Paul and Silas flogged and jailed. Devices: power encounter, injustice setup.
Midnight praise; quake opens doors; ‘What must I do to be saved?’; Roman citizenship forces apology. Devices: sign‑deliverance, legal status appeal.
Reasoning from Scriptures; charge of turning the world upside down; bail taken. Devices: synagogue proof, civic disturbance.
Daily Scripture searching; many believe; opposition pursues Paul. Devices: evaluative praise, protective escort.
Unknown God proclamation; call to repent in light of resurrection; mixed responses. Devices: cultural citation, rhetorical adaptation.
Work with Aquila/Priscilla; opposition; Lord’s vision assures protection; 18 months ministry. Devices: tentmaking note, oracle assurance.
Roman refusal to adjudicate intra‑Jewish matter; Sosthenes beaten. Devices: legal precedent, ironic reversal.
Vow noted; brief stops; ‘gone up’ and returned to Antioch close inclusio. Devices: itinerary compress, inclusio marker.

stories.story_title: Third Missionary Journey and the Ephesian Triumph
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (18:23) strengthening churches through Galatia/Phrygia; end (21:16) arrival in Jerusalem after layered warnings. Glue: Ephesus focus (19), triumph over magic, travel farewell rhythms, and Spirit‑prompted resolve toward Jerusalem.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Apollos instructed by Priscilla/Aquila; Ephesian disciples receive the Spirit with tongues/prophecy. Devices: transitional figure, confirming signs.
Long synagogue/school ministry; failed exorcists exposed; public burning of magic books; word grows. Devices: contrast power, victory summary.
Economic threat sparks civic uproar; town clerk dismisses assembly. Devices: mob chant refrain, political de‑escalation.
Itinerary compression; late‑night fall and revival of Eutychus; sailing choices avoid delay. Devices: travel ledger, miracle interlude.
Testamentary speech: past service, future wolves, commendation to God; tearful parting. Devices: farewell genre, inclusio of tears.
Prophetic warnings (Tyre, Agabus) met by Paul’s resolve; lodging set for arrival. Devices: repeated warnings, submission formula (‘The Lord’s will be done’).

stories.story_title: Arrest, Trials, Voyage, and Rome (Apostolic Climax)
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (21:17) with Jerusalem arrival leading to arrest/trials; end (28:31) with unhindered preaching in Rome. Glue: serial defenses centered on the resurrection, divine ‘must’/assurance (23:11), and providential protection culminating in Rome.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Purification advice followed by temple accusation and riot; Roman rescue. Devices: irony (compromise→riot), echo of ‘Away with him!’
Hebrew address recounts conversion/commission; mention of Gentiles triggers fury. Devices: code‑switching, commission climax.
Roman citizenship halts torture; case referred to the council. Devices: legal status reveal, procedural shift.
Council divided Pharisees/Sadducees; night vision promises Rome. Devices: partisan division tactic, reassurance oracle.
Assassination plot foiled by nephew; escorted to Felix with letter. Devices: providential disclosure, official correspondence.
Tertullus’s flattery vs Paul’s clear defense; delay with light custody. Devices: forensic rhetoric, adjournment.
Reasoning on righteousness, self‑control, judgment; Felix trembles then stalls; two‑year delay. Devices: tailored exhortation, moral hesitation.
Jews press charges; Paul asserts innocence and appeals to Caesar. Devices: jurisdictional move, legal pivot.
Conversion/commission retold; nearly persuades Agrippa; verdict: could be freed but for appeal. Devices: royal audience, persuasive climax.
Prophetic counsel ignored; storm; angel assures all will live; shipwreck survival; healings in Malta. Devices: nautical ‘we’ detail, prophecy fulfilled.

scenes.scene_name: Rome: Final Witness and Unhindered Word
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Jewish leaders hear; Isaiah 6 cited; two years preaching without hindrance. Devices: Isaiah citation, open‑ended summary.
